snippet: A court ruled that the exterior of the enclosure of a bust of Franklin D. Roosevelt could bear the name of one donor; a second donor agreed to a less prominent location.
abstract: Legal battle over the placement of inscriptions acknowledging two largest donors to the Franklin D Roosevelt Four Freedoms Park and memorial on Roosevelt Island is resolved in New York State Supreme Court hearing; Alphawood Foundation will have four inscriptions at the north end of the park, and the Reed Foundation's name will appear on a separate slab next to a wall that bears the names of all the benefactors.
lead_paragraph: A court ruled that the exterior of the enclosure of a bust of Franklin D. Roosevelt could bear the name of one donor; a second donor agreed to a less prominent location.

headline.seo: Donors to Roosevelt Monument Agree on Acknowledgments
headline.main: Deal Is Reached on Placement of Donors’ Names at a Roosevelt Monument
headline.print_headline: Deal on Placement of Donors’ Names At a Roosevelt Monument Is Reached

keywords.value: Roosevelt, Franklin D, Four Freedoms Park (NYC)
